description: From deontology +â€Ž -ical (1832). The specialised sense in normative ethics is due to C. D. Broad (1930).

adjectives.description: deontological (comparative more deontological, superlative most deontological)

entries.meaning: (ethics, philosophy) Of or relating to deontology.
examples: Deontological theories hold that there are ethical propositions of the form: 'Such and such a kind of action would always be right (or wrong) in such and such circumstances, no matter what its consequences might be.'
